solution.text:
Using Pythagoras theorem we find AB
AB=\((_{{29*j}}_)^2-(_{{20*j}}_)^2=(AB)^2\)
AB=\(\sqrt{(_{{29*j}}_-_{{20*j}}_)(_{{29*j}}_+_{{20*j}}_)}\)
\(AB=_{{21*j}}_\)
We know, sinC=\(perpendicualar\over hypotenuse\)
sinC=\(_{{21*j}}_\over _{{29*j}}_\)
We know, cosC=\(base\over hypotenuse\)
cosC=\(_{{20*j}}_\over _{{29*j}}_\)
=\(sin^2C+cos^2C\)=\(_{{20*j*20*j}}_\over _{{29*j*29*j}}_\)+\(_{{21*21*j*j}}_\over _{{29*j*j*29}}_\)
therefore,\(sin^2C+cos^2C\)=1
Similarly by using formula,tanC=\(perpendicualar\over base\)
tanC=\(_{{21*j}}_\over _{{20*j}}_\)
secC=\(1\over cosC\)
secC=\(_{{29*j}}_\over _{{20*j}}_\)
by putting the values we get
\(sec^2C-tan^2C=1\)
Now since \(sin^2C+cos^2C\)=1 and \(cos^2C\) is not zero, so \(sin^2C-cos^2C\) is NOT Equal to 1

content.text:
In a right angled triangle ABC, angle(ACB)=C.
If base(BC)=_{{j*20}}_ and hypotenuse(AC)=_{{j*29}}_,
Which of the following expressions will be equal to 1
